intro: Humboltia pectinata, commonly known as the pectinate hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a hairy texture, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Humboltia pectinata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils.
